1.title: Spaghetti
instructions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Fry meat until browned and add spices.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and grated Parmesan cheese together. Season with black pepper.
In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat with garlic and pancetta drippings.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture. Toss until creamy and well combined.
Crumble crispy pancetta over the top and serve hot.

2.title: Chicken
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
In a skillet, melt butter and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add chicken breasts and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Cook until sauce thickens.
Slice cooked chicken into strips and add it back to the skillet.

3.title: Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add a bit of oil.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli, bell pepper, carrot, and snap peas. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat. Cook until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

4.title: Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, and melted butter.
Mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Brown on both sides and serve hot.

5.title: Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, toss mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion together.
Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss to coat.
Top with crumbled feta cheese and serve immediately.

6.title: Kosher Beef Burger
ingredients: slices of kosher cheese (optional, ensure dairy-free if serving with meat)
instructions: Divide kosher ground beef into 4 equal portions and shape into patties.
Season patties with kosher salt and black pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and brush with olive oil. Grill patties until cooked to your desired doneness.
Toast hamburger buns on the grill until lightly golden.
Spread mustard and ketchup on the bottom half of each bun.
Layer each bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, and a grilled patty.
If using cheese and keeping kosher, ensure it's a non-dairy cheese alternative. Place it on the patty right before it finishes cooking to melt slightly.

7.title: Tacos
instructions: In a skillet, cook ground beef until browned. Season with taco seasoning.
Heat taco shells according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with cooked ground beef.
Top with lettuce, tomato, onion, sour cream, salsa, guacamole, and chopped cilantro.

8.title: Salmon
instructions: In a bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Marinate salmon fillets in the mixture for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through.

9.title: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed.
Stir in boiling water. The batter will be thin.
Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
Frost with chocolate frosting and serve.
